Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all,
>Personally, I have not made up my mind on this. I guess that an ap=
plication is limited >to a single service unless the service itself point t=
o another service itself.
I don't know that I agree with this, not that you=
 are saying it can or can not be allowed. I believe since the client drives=
 the process, the client can call as many services as it wants to present a=
 valid UI for a user. Think of a web page, where it may call different page=
s in frames, or separate div css tags. Mashups as well are basically=A0aggr=
egated=A0service calls to present multiple things in the UI. I see no reaso=
n a client can only use a single URI to start with. =A0After all, you don't=
 only use a single API call in your own code, there should be no restrictio=
n on a client using multiple service resources to build up a single view to=
 the end user. Just my opinion tho.








      
--0-741734163-1267394796=:32570
